intro: Octomeria pacii, commonly known as the Pacific octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, often covered in a fine, silky hair. Octomeria pacii thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in areas with high humidity and coastal breezes.
